info.team: Our team was recreated almost in the same form as in the final task of stage2 of the course, Ekaterina and Nadezhda were already in the team and worked well together. We met Eugene at one of the cross-checks and since Eugene already had experience working with React, he fit in perfectly with our team.
info.project_nadyavalin: Nadezhda is the team lead, organized the work on the github board, made the basic settings of the configuration files in the first sprint, set up redux (store) / layout, made the header, buttons and the main UI, wrote the Welcome page, completely translated the entire application, implementing i18n and providing internalization in two languages ​​(English and Russian), added a 404 page and error / errorBoundary.
info.project_LarryDavidd: Eugene set up the project structure at the very beginning fsd. Made all the functionality of RestFull Client and Graph QL.
info.project_katika: Katya made login/registration forms, provided field validation, connected the token, made the UI RestFull Client and Graph QL.
info.course: We are grateful to this course for the opportunity to learn React/Nextjs in such a short time. The practice gave us an understanding of what we still need to learn after the course, what gaps to fill. We hope that after gaining sufficient experience, we will return to this course as mentors!

nadyavalin.name: Nadezhda Tkachuk
nadyavalin.desc: I am a leading specialist in auditing and monitoring processes and projects. My responsibilities include monitoring projects, monitoring how project managers apply different methodologies. They call me a scrum master, but I just help managers manage their projects in Bitrix correctly. I reflect all useful information in the Bitrix Knowledge Base. At my job, I achieved all this thanks to the skills I acquired at RSSchool. Now I want to become a full-fledged front-end developer and apply my skills (together with back-end developers) in software development at my current job.

katika.name: Ekaterina Mashko
katika.desc: I graduated from BSU with a degree in biotechnology and worked in the pharmaceutical industry for many years. My interest in technology, beautiful and user-friendly interfaces, and the desire to learn led me to the world of programming. Studying at school allowed me to acquire the necessary skills, the ability to work independently and in a team, and to develop according to technical specifications. My dream is to work on a project related to biotechnology, science, education, or medicine.
